title: Explained: Women's Boxing Match At Paris Olympics Sparks Gender Row
content: Algerian boxer Imane Khelif, who failed a gender eligibility test last year, knocked their Italian opponent out in 46 seconds in the 66 kg women's boxing category and has drawn the ire of Italian Prime Minister Georgia Meloni.
summary: Algerian boxer Imane Khelif, who failed a gender eligibility test last year, knocked their Italian opponent out in 46 seconds in the 66 kg women's boxing category and has drawn the ire of Italian Prime Minister Georgia Meloni.

title: As India, Vietnam Strengthen Ties, PM Modi Speaks Against "Expansionism"
content: India, Vietnam adopted an action plan to expand strategic ties with PM Modi vowing to work jointly for a rules-based Indo-Pacific and asserting that New Delhi supports development and "not expansionism" in remarks that came amid concerns over China.
summary: India, Vietnam adopted an action plan to expand strategic ties with PM Modi vowing to work jointly for a rules-based Indo-Pacific and asserting that New Delhi supports development and "not expansionism" in remarks that came amid concerns over China.

title: Russia Frees US Reporter In Major Prisoner Swap With West, Says Turkey
content: US journalist Evan Gershkovich and former US marine Paul Whelan are expected to be released by Russia as part of one of the biggest East-West prisoner swaps since the Cold War, according to US media Thursday.
summary: US journalist Evan Gershkovich and former US marine Paul Whelan are expected to be released by Russia as part of one of the biggest East-West prisoner swaps since the Cold War, according to US media Thursday.

title: 10 Key Moments In Israel-Hamas War
content: After members of the Palestinian militant group Hamas carried out the worst attack in Israeli history, on October 7, 2023, Israel responded with a devastating military campaign in the Gaza Strip.
summary: After members of the Palestinian militant group Hamas carried out the worst attack in Israeli history, on October 7, 2023, Israel responded with a devastating military campaign in the Gaza Strip.

title: Amazon Set To Join Big Tech's Spending Surge As AI Race Heats Up
content: As a result of the spending increase, Amazon's gross profit margin growth is expected to have slowed to 1.3% in the April-June quarter, compared with 2.6% in the previous quarter and an average of 2.7% over the past two years.
summary: As a result of the spending increase, Amazon's gross profit margin growth is expected to have slowed to 1.3% in the April-June quarter, compared with 2.6% in the previous quarter and an average of 2.7% over the past two years.

title: Japan To Now Hunt Second-Largest Whale Species
content: Japan has expanded its commercial whaling to include fin whales, the second-largest animal species on the planet, a decision criticised by Australia's government on Thursday.
summary: Japan has expanded its commercial whaling to include fin whales, the second-largest animal species on the planet, a decision criticised by Australia's government on Thursday.

title: 30 Killed, 35 Missing After Torrential Rains In China: Report
content: At least 30 people are dead and 35 are missing in central China, state media reported Thursday, following days of torrential rain that lashed the country earlier this week.
summary: At least 30 people are dead and 35 are missing in central China, state media reported Thursday, following days of torrential rain that lashed the country earlier this week.

title: July Becomes China's Hottest Month On Record Since 1961
content: Chinese weather authorities said Thursday July was the country's hottest month since records began six decades ago, as extreme temperatures persist across the globe.
summary: Chinese weather authorities said Thursday July was the country's hottest month since records began six decades ago, as extreme temperatures persist across the globe.

title: US Woman Learns Of Rs 1.73 Crore Lottery Win From Spam Email
content: Since the BIG CA$H Second Chance games launched in 2022, players have won more than $8 million in progressive prizes, according to lottery organisers.
summary: Since the BIG CA$H Second Chance games launched in 2022, players have won more than $8 million in progressive prizes, according to lottery organisers.

title: Who Was Mohammed Deif, Hamas Military Wing Chief Confirmed Dead By Israel
content: Mohammed Deif, the head of Hamas' military wing, was killed in an airstrike in Gaza last month, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) have confirmed. Deif was believed to be a key architect of the October 7 attack, which killed 1,195 people in Israel.
summary: Mohammed Deif, the head of Hamas' military wing, was killed in an airstrike in Gaza last month, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) have confirmed. Deif was believed to be a key architect of the October 7 attack, which killed 1,195 people in Israel.

title: OpenAI May Post $5 Billion Loss, Run Out Of Cash In 12 Months: Report
content: OpenAI is projected to earn between $3 billion to $4.5 billion in 2024, leaving behind a deficit of $5 billion in losses: The Information
summary: OpenAI is projected to earn between $3 billion to $4.5 billion in 2024, leaving behind a deficit of $5 billion in losses: The Information

title: OpenAI Says Dedicated To Safety In Letter To US Lawmakers
content: The startup sought to reassure lawmakers of its commitment to safety after five senators raised questions about OpenAI's safety policies.
summary: The startup sought to reassure lawmakers of its commitment to safety after five senators raised questions about OpenAI's safety policies.

title: Blinken Urges End To "Escalatory Actions" For All Parties In Middle East
content: The strike that killed Ismail Haniyeh came just hours after Israel said it had killed a top Hezbollah commander in a retaliatory strike on the Lebanese capital Beirut. The killings took place as regional tensions were already inflamed by the war.
summary: The strike that killed Ismail Haniyeh came just hours after Israel said it had killed a top Hezbollah commander in a retaliatory strike on the Lebanese capital Beirut. The killings took place as regional tensions were already inflamed by the war.

title: Weeks After "Blue Screen Of Death", Microsoft Suffers New Outage
content: The tech giant said it was a DDoS attack that floods a service with traffic in order to bring them to a standstill.
summary: The tech giant said it was a DDoS attack that floods a service with traffic in order to bring them to a standstill.

title: Hamas Military Chief Mohammed Deif Killed In Gaza Strike: Israel
content: The Israeli military on Thursday announced that Hamas military chief Mohammed Deif had been killed in a strike it carried out last month in Gaza's southern area of Khan Yunis.
summary: The Israeli military on Thursday announced that Hamas military chief Mohammed Deif had been killed in a strike it carried out last month in Gaza's southern area of Khan Yunis.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy Accuses Kamala Harris Of Leaning Into 'Identity Politics'

title: Kerala Police Has Warned Against 'Dark Tourism'. Know What It Is
content: Dark tourism has gained global attention in recent years, partly thanks to TV shows like Chernobyl and The Dark Tourist.

title: Iran Holds Funeral For Hamas Chief Haniyeh, Calls For "Revenge" On Israel
content: The Islamic republic's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei will lead the prayers for Haniyeh ahead of his burial in Doha, having earlier threatened a "harsh punishment" for his killing.
summary: The Islamic republic's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei will lead the prayers for Haniyeh ahead of his burial in Doha, having earlier threatened a "harsh punishment" for his killing.

title: UK PM To Meet Cops Over Stabbing Attack As Protesters Chant "Save Our Kids"
content: There were angry scenes in London on Wednesday evening as thousands of anti-immigration protesters gathered near Starmer's Downing Street office and residence chanting "save our kids" and "we want our country back".
summary: There were angry scenes in London on Wednesday evening as thousands of anti-immigration protesters gathered near Starmer's Downing Street office and residence chanting "save our kids" and "we want our country back".

title: Voting For Kamala Harris's Democratic Nomination Set To Begin Today
content: Less than two weeks after Joe Biden ended his re election bid, his 52-year-old vice president is in full control of the party, having emerged as the only Democrat in the running to challenge Republican Donald Trump in November.
summary: Less than two weeks after Joe Biden ended his re election bid, his 52-year-old vice president is in full control of the party, having emerged as the only Democrat in the running to challenge Republican Donald Trump in November.
